# performRequests(_:options:)

**Instance Method**

Performs an authorization request, with explicit options, from the provided array.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor func performRequests(_ requests: [ASAuthorizationRequest], options: ASAuthorizationController.RequestOptions) async throws -> ASAuthorizationResult
```

## Parameters

- **requests**: An array of supported authorization requests.
- **options**: Additional options that customize the request’s behavior. For more information, see [doc://com.apple.authenticationservices/documentation/AuthenticationServices/ASAuthorizationController/RequestOptions].

## Return Value

The request’s outcome. For more information, see [doc://com.apple.authenticationservices/documentation/AuthenticationServices/ASAuthorizationResult].

## Discussion

The framework checks each authorization request in the array against the credentials available on the person’s device; the more credential types your app supports, the more options a person can choose from.

## Performing requests

- **performRequest(_:)**: Performs the specified authorization request.
- **performRequests(_:)**: Performs an authorization request from the provided array.
- **performRequest(_:options:)**: Performs the specified authorization request with explicit options.
- **performRequest(_:customMethods:)**: Performs the authorization request using a custom authorization method.
- **performRequests(_:customMethods:)**: Performs an authorization request from the provided array using a custom authorization method.
